nodes.bodyText: ??? why "others" if the anger is "universal"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_5398 net/minecraft/entity/ai/goal/UniversalAngerGoal
+	FIELD field_25604 entityType Lnet/minecraft/class_1308;
+	FIELD field_25605 angerOthers Z

nodes.bodyText: Universal anger, per the gamerule, means that an angry mob will be angry at every player rather than just the one that attacked them. It does not mean that every mob will be angry. This method is used for mobs that attack in groups (bees, wolves, zombie piglins) to notify others in range to get mad (at no one in particular, just get mad).

nodes.bodyText: Maybe just ANGER_DURATION or ANGER_TIME since this type is already a range.
Problem is ANGER_TIME already exists for the Wolf's actual current anger time. I'll just go with ANGER_TIME_RANGE I guess

Don't think wiki.vg is that reliable on new contents. For example, you can see that mojang writes registry to a compound tag from code while wiki.vg was initially broken by the dfu codec registry update
Fyi wiki.vg's license is cc0 sharealike while yarn is cc0 (no sharealike). As a result, you cannot use wiki.vg's content as your evidence/reason for naming a member.
If this is the case, we should amend our contributing.md to explicitly prohibit use of wiki.vg for reference
This renders the name of the rule on the left side of the screen. Not actually a render method. The widgets are rendered by implementations of the NamedRuleWidget
